result.execSummary:
The defendant Fernando Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 4/15/2016 or penalty of 7 days Huber for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fernando Martinez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Ralph M. Ramirez on April 4, 2016.
records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Thomas Voss

Defendant Fernando Martinez in court with attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter, sworn in.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Case #15CT335 is dismissed and read into count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Voss makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
FINE: $505.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 4/15/2016.  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 7 days in Huber
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Court grants the request for an adjournment.  Court sets this case for a plea hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
